titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: casualty list brings the British losses to about 15,000 killed, wounded & missing. Some of the latter will probably rejoin the Army after an interval.
Burgess & her daughter Barbara, who arrived on Saturday to spend Sunday in Durham, left the Deanery this morning.

I attended a meeting of the National Relief Committee at the Shire Hall: & afterwards went on to the Assize Court, where the recruits were being sworn in. They appeared for the most part a fine well–built set of young men, nearly all miners.

Steinthal came to see me. He has enlisted, & is now concerned for his wife, who will continue to live in Durham. Would the Dean & Chapter, as Governing Body, make his wife an allowance? I said that the disposition of the D. & C. would certainly be as favourable as the circumstances permitted: & I asked what amount he considered w
be sufficient. He mentioned £100. I said that I w
consult my colleagues, & let him know what we would do.
